article.Heading: Budget 2017: Arun Jaitley lists 3 threats to emerging markets
article.Summary: While tabling the Union Budget 2017-18, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said that at present the world economy faces a lot of uncertainty nut India remains to be a bright spot in the global landscape.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

While tabling the Union Budget 2017-18, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said that right now the world economy faces a lot of uncertainty. But India remains to be a bright spot in the global landscape.

Listing various threats to the economic growth, Jaitley said that the current monetary stance of US Federal Reserve remains a major concern as they forecast further rate hikes in the coming year.

3 challenges in current global scenario:Monetary stance of US FED Reserve, Commodity prices specially crude oil & retreat from globalisation

— Ministry of Finance (@FinMinIndia) February 1, 2017

He also said that uncertainty around commodity prices especially crude oil and the increasing retreat from globalisation of goods as pressures of protectionism build up globally remain as reasons of worry for emerging markets.
